Type.Name: Unit
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

remarks.para: The structure represents a length measurement that can be expressed in any HTML-compatible size unit. The enumeration lists the units of measurement that can be represented. The is used by properties such as BorderWidth and Height to represent the length or width of the property. For example, you can set the property of a Web Server control to a that represents five pixels.

block.para: The class can represent values only between -32768 and 32767.

remarks.para: Use the property to determine the length of the measurement. The unit of measurement is determined using the property. You can convert other data types to a by using the , , , and methods.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of , see the constructor.

summary.para: Represents a length measurement.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the structure using the specified double precision floating point number.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of .

block.para: If is not between -32768 and 32767, an exception is thrown.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the structure with the specified double precision floating point number.

Docs.param: A double precision floating point number that represents the length of the in pixels.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the structure using the specified 32-bit signed integer.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of .

block.para: If is not between -32768 and 32767, an exception is thrown.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the structure with the specified 32-bit signed integer.

Docs.param: A 32-bit signed integer that represents the length of the in pixels.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the structure using the specified length. The length is specified in two parts, the length's value and the length's unit type. For example, "200Cm" represents a length of 200 centimeters. You can use any valid CSS-compliant unit expression.
The following table lists the common unit types.

description.para: Length in points. A point represents 1/72 of an inch.
Length as a percentage of the parent element.

remarks.para: The following table shows initial property values for an instance of .

block.para: If is not between -32768 and 32767, an exception is thrown.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the structure with the specified length.

Docs.param: A string that represents the length of the .

The following table shows initial property values for an instance of .

block.para: If is not between -32768 and 32767, an exception is thrown.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the structure with the specified double precision floating point number and .

Docs.param: A double precision floating point number that represents the length of the .
One of the enumeration values.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the structure using the specified length and . The length is specified in two parts, the length's value and the length's unit type. For example, "200Cm" represents a length of 200 centimeters. You can use any valid CSS-compliant unit expression.
The following table lists the common unit types.

description.para: Length in points. A point represents 1/72 of an inch.
Length as a percentage of the parent element.

summary.para: Represents an empty . This field is read-only.

remarks.para: Use the method to compare the that this method is called from with the object specified by . For both objects to be equal, they must have the same values for both the and properties.

block.para: The object specified by must by a type object for the comparison to succeed. If the object is null, false is returned.

summary.para: Compares this with the specified object.

returns.para: true if the that this method is called from is equal to the specified object; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The object for comparison.

summary.para: Returns a hash code for this .

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'bool'

remarks.para: Use the property to determine whether the is empty. The is empty if the property contains an enumeration value of 0.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether the is empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool op_Equality (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit left, System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit right);

remarks.para: Use this operator to compare two objects for equality. For both objects to be equal, they must have the same values for both the and properties.

summary.para: Compares two objects to determine whether they are equal.

returns.para: true if both objects are equal; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The on the left side of the operator.
The on the right side of the operator.
To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool op_Inequality (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit left, System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit right);

remarks.para: Use this operator to compare two objects for inequality. For the objects to not be equal, they must have different values for the property or the property.

summary.para: Compares two objects to determine whether they are not equal.

returns.para: true if the objects are not equal; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The on the left side of the operator.
The on the right side of the operator.

remarks.para: Use the static method to convert the string specified by the parameter to a .

block.para: The unit of measurement when using this method is .

remarks.para: Use the static method to create a of type that represents the length specified by the parameter. For example, if you specify 80 for n and use the returned unit to set the of a Web server control, the height attribute is set to 80%.

block.para: The class can represent values only between -32768 and 32767.

remarks.para: The method returns a string representation formatted with a unit and an abbreviation representing the unit . The following table lists values and their corresponding abbreviation.
Use to specify culture-specific information used to format the . If is null, the numeric portion of the string is formatted using a default object set for the current culture.

summary.para: Converts a to a string equivalent using the specified format provider.

returns.para: A representing this in the format specified by .

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'UnitType'

remarks.para: Use the property to determine the unit of measurement that the represents, such as pixels. The property is represented by one of the enumeration values.

block.para: If property is set to true, the enumeration value is returned.

summary.para: Gets the unit type of the .

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'double'
